tools.title: Termux
tools.desc: An Android terminal emulator and Linux environment app.

tools.title: Ghidra
tools.desc: A software reverse engineering (SRE) framework developed by the NSA.

tools.title: Google Summer of Code
tools.desc: A global program focused on bringing student developers into open source software development.
tools.stipend: Varies by country (e.g., ~$3000 USD)
tools.eligibility: 18+ years old, enrolled in or recently graduated from a post-secondary program.

tools.title: MLH Fellowship
tools.desc: A remote internship alternative for aspiring software engineers. Gain hands-on experience by contributing to open source projects.
tools.stipend: Need-based stipend up to $5,000
tools.eligibility: Open to students and recent graduates over 18. No prior experience required for some tracks.

tools.title: Outreachy
tools.desc: Provides paid, remote internships in open source and open science to people subject to systemic bias and underrepresentation in the technical industry.
tools.stipend: $7,000 USD total stipend for the 3-month internship.
tools.eligibility: Applicants must be 18+ and available for a full-time, 3-month internship. Not open to residents of countries with US trade sanctions.

tools.title: LFX Mentorship Program
tools.desc: Paid remote mentorships from the Linux Foundation. Work with experienced open-source developers on real projects.
tools.stipend: Stipend provided, amount varies by program.
tools.eligibility: Varies by project. Generally open to all, no student status required for many.

tools.title: Google Season of Docs
tools.desc: Provides paid opportunities for technical writers to contribute to open source projects and improve their documentation.
tools.stipend: Stipends vary by project and location, typically around $3,000 - $6,600 USD.
tools.eligibility: Must be 18+ and eligible to work in their country of residence.

tools.title: Microsoft Learn Student Ambassador
tools.desc: A program for students to build their technical skills, create community, and and share their knowledge with peers.
tools.stipend: Unpaid, but provides access to Microsoft resources, tools, and networking opportunities.
tools.eligibility: Must be 16+ and enrolled full-time in an accredited academic institution.

tools.title: NASA Internships
tools.desc: Offers paid internships for students to work on exciting NASA projects and contribute to space exploration and research.
tools.stipend: Stipends are provided and vary based on academic level and session duration.
tools.eligibility: U.S. citizen, full-time student (high school to graduate), minimum 3.0 GPA.

tools.title: Red Hat Internships
tools.desc: Gain real-world experience in a leading open-source company. Internships available in software engineering, IT, marketing, and more.
tools.stipend: Competitive paid internships.
tools.eligibility: Varies by role. Typically for students pursuing a Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD.

tools.title: Intel Internships
tools.desc: Work on challenging projects in hardware and software engineering, AI, manufacturing, and more at a global tech leader.
tools.stipend: Competitive salary and benefits.
tools.eligibility: Enrolled in a relevant Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD program.

tools.title: Palantir Path
tools.desc: A unique internship experience for students from underrepresented backgrounds in tech, providing mentorship and real-world projects.
tools.stipend: Highly competitive salary, housing, and travel covered.
tools.eligibility: Open to first and second-year undergraduate students.

tools.title: Twitter Academy
tools.desc: A 12-week paid summer internship program for second-year students designed to build technical skills and provide a pathway to a career in tech.
tools.stipend: Competitive salary and perks.
tools.eligibility: Enrolled in a four-year degree program with an expected graduation date within two years.

tools.title: Facebook University
tools.desc: A hands-on, immersive internship program for first and second-year college students from underrepresented communities.
tools.stipend: Competitive salary, housing, and other benefits.
tools.eligibility: First or second-year student currently enrolled in a four-year bachelor's program.

tools.title: Amazon Future Engineer
tools.desc: A paid internship and scholarship program for high school and undergraduate students from underserved communities to explore careers in computer science.
tools.stipend: Competitive salary, housing stipend, and other benefits.
tools.eligibility: Varies by program, but generally for high school seniors and college freshmen.

tools.title: Adobe Digital Academy
tools.desc: Offers career-switchers from non-traditional backgrounds the education and experience needed to launch successful careers in tech.
tools.stipend: Covers tuition for a web development bootcamp and provides a paid internship.
tools.eligibility: Open to individuals with non-traditional, non-technical backgrounds.

tools.title: Dropbox Launch
tools.desc: A summer internship program for rising college sophomores and juniors from underrepresented groups in tech.
tools.stipend: Competitive salary, housing, and travel.
tools.eligibility: Current sophomore or junior pursuing a degree in CS or a related field.

tools.title: LinkedIn REACH
tools.desc: A multi-year, rotational program designed to help individuals from non-traditional backgrounds build a career in software engineering.
tools.stipend: Competitive salary and benefits.
tools.eligibility: Aimed at individuals with a passion for coding who do not have a CS degree.

tools.title: UberSTAR
tools.desc: A paid internship program for first and second-year students, providing hands-on experience and mentorship.
tools.stipend: Competitive salary and perks.
tools.eligibility: First or second-year students in a four-year degree program.

tools.title: Pinterest Engage
tools.desc: An 8-week summer program for first-year college students to gain exposure to the tech industry and build their technical skills.
tools.stipend: Competitive salary and benefits.
tools.eligibility: First-year student pursuing a bachelor's degree.

tools.title: Goldman Sachs Engineering Possibilities
tools.desc: A one-day summit for first and second-year students to learn about software engineering careers in finance.
tools.stipend: Unpaid (one-day event), but travel and accommodation may be covered.
tools.eligibility: First or second-year undergraduate students.

tools.title: Morgan Stanley Early Insights
tools.desc: Various insight programs for students in their early years of university to explore careers in the financial services industry.
tools.stipend: Generally unpaid (insight programs), but can lead to paid internships.
tools.eligibility: Varies by program, typically for first and second-year students.

tools.title: JPMorgan Chase Code for Good
tools.desc: A hackathon where students work with non-profits to solve real-world problems, with opportunities for internships.
tools.stipend: Event-based, but top participants are often fast-tracked for paid internships.
tools.eligibility: Current students pursuing a degree in a STEM field.

tools.title: Capital One Software Engineering Summit
tools.desc: An immersive multi-day program for freshmen and sophomores to explore software engineering at Capital One.
tools.stipend: Unpaid (summit), but all expenses are covered. Can lead to paid internships.
tools.eligibility: Freshman or sophomore standing in a four-year institution.

tools.title: Two Sigma Freshman Internship
tools.desc: A quantitative finance firm offering a paid summer internship for first-year undergraduate students to work on real projects.
tools.stipend: Extremely competitive salary and benefits.
tools.eligibility: First-year undergraduate students in a technical field.

tools.title: Jane Street Freshman & Sophomore Programs
tools.desc: Offers various programs for early-career students to learn about quantitative trading, research, and software engineering.
tools.stipend: Highly competitive pay, housing, and other perks.
tools.eligibility: Open to freshmen and sophomores in technical or quantitative fields.
